content: Section 1 introduces a new constructive sales treatment for appreciated financial positions under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. If there is a constructive sale of an appreciated financial position, the taxpayer must recognize gain as if the position were sold for its fair market value on the date of the constructive sale. Any gain must be included in the taxable year that includes the date of the sale. Adjustments will be made for any subsequent gain or loss realized with respect to the position after the constructive sale. Adjustments are made for any subsequent gain or loss realized after a constructive sale of an appreciated financial position. The holding period is determined as if the position were acquired on the date of the sale. The term 'appreciated financial position' refers to any position with potential gain upon sale, including stock, debt instruments, or partnership interests.
